database_info.name: default_database_V01
database_info.description: This is the initial test database

unenveloped virion.name: unenveloped virion
unenveloped virion.description: Basic Virion without a plasma membrane

enveloped virion.name: enveloped virion
enveloped virion.description: Basic virion with a plasma membrane. Will degrade faster.

unenveloped virion (extracellular).name: unenveloped virion (extracellular)
unenveloped virion (extracellular).description: Basic viral particle outside the cell

ENV - 3Dpol - RNA dep RNA-Polymerase.name: ENV - 3Dpol - RNA dep RNA-Polymerase
ENV - 3Dpol - RNA dep RNA-Polymerase.description: Picornavirus RNA Polymerase. Copies your RNA.

MeV - F Fusion gylcoprotein.name: MeV - F Fusion gylcoprotein
MeV - F Fusion gylcoprotein.description: Measles virus fusion protein fuses a bound virion with the plasmamembrane.

rule.name: Transport of surface proteins to membrane

MeV - L RNA dep RNA-polymerase.name: MeV - L RNA dep RNA-polymerase
MeV - L RNA dep RNA-polymerase.description: The Paramyxovirus RNA polymerase. Copies your RNA... Requires a replication co-factor! In nature, this is the P protein.

MeV - H Hemagglutinin.name: MeV - H Hemagglutinin
MeV - H Hemagglutinin.description: The measles virus hemaglutinin binds to SLAMF1 CD150 receptor.

CoV - N nucleoprotein.name: CoV - N nucleoprotein
CoV - N nucleoprotein.description: Coronavirus nucleocapsid. Important for genome packing

CoV - S glycoprotein.name: CoV - S glycoprotein
CoV - S glycoprotein.description: Spike glycoprotein binds to ACE2, mediates adheason and entry. Provides a plus-strand RNA virus backbone

CoV - S2 domain - membrane fusion.name: CoV - S2 domain - membrane fusion
CoV - S2 domain - membrane fusion.description: Important for entry. Requires S glycoprotein.

ENV - VP1-VP4.name: ENV - VP1-VP4
ENV - VP1-VP4.description: Viral capsid proteins from the Picornavirus family. Provides a plus-strand RNA virus backbone

CoV - nsp12 RdRP.name: CoV - nsp12 RdRP
CoV - nsp12 RdRP.description: Coronavirus RNA polymerase. Copies your RNA... Also makes sub-genomic RNA.

rule.name: Picorna-like RdRp synthesis of sub-genomic RNA

CoV - nsp5 Mpro.name: CoV - nsp5 Mpro
CoV - nsp5 Mpro.description: Coronavirus Protease. Cleaves Polyprotein. Releases an RNA dep. RNA-polymerase

LV - env gene - gp120 gp41.name: LV - env gene - gp120 gp41
LV - env gene - gp120 gp41.description: Lentiviral glycoproteins. Mediate release of capsid into the cytoplasm. Also allow formation of new lentiviral virions

rule.name: Transport of surface proteins to membrane

LV - gag gene.name: LV - gag gene
LV - gag gene.description: These are the structural proteins of the lentiviruses. Mediate nuclear import of capsid contents

rule.name: gag mediated nucleus import and release

LV - pol gene.name: LV - pol gene
LV - pol gene.description: contains the RT and integrase of lentiviruses.

ENV - VPg.name: ENV - VPg
ENV - VPg.description: Picornavirus Replication co-factor. Positive-sense ssRNA can produce replication co-factor

MeV - P phosphoprotein.name: MeV - P phosphoprotein
MeV - P phosphoprotein.description: P phosphoprotein acts as the Co-factor for the L Polymerase. Ingame produces generic Replication co-factors.

CoV - backbone.name: CoV - backbone
CoV - backbone.description: Provides a coronavirus like genomic backbone. Unpacks genome complex into positive sense ssRNA, translates Polyprotein and protease.

ENV - backbone.name: ENV - backbone
ENV - backbone.description: Genomic backbone of a Picornavirus. Allows pore formation and injection of viral RNA from membrane bound virions. Positive sense ssRNA produces Polyprotein and Protease.

LV - backbone.name: LV - backbone
LV - backbone.description: Lentivirus backbone. Includes transcription, mRNA export and translation

MeV - backbone.name: MeV - backbone
MeV - backbone.description: Genomic backbone of a Paramyxovirus. Allows translation of an RNA polymerase and structural proteins for ER.

rule.name: Translation of viral RNA for ER

LV - Tat gene.name: LV - Tat gene
LV - Tat gene.description: Greatly enhances transcription effeciency of proviral DNA

LV - Rev gene.name: LV - Rev gene
LV - Rev gene.description: Improves export of viral mRNAs out of the nucleus

INF - NP nucleoprotein.name: INF - NP nucleoprotein
INF - NP nucleoprotein.description: Transports the RNP to the nucleus. Also exports RNA from the nucleus

rule.name: Import of structural proteins into nucleus

INF - backbone.name: INF - backbone
INF - backbone.description: Provides an Influenzavirus genomic backbone. Transcribes viral RNA.

rule.name: Translation of viral RNA for ER

INF - PB1 PB2 PA polymerase complex.name: INF - PB1 PB2 PA polymerase complex

rule.name: Export of modified positive sense RNA

INF - NA neuraminidase.name: INF - NA neuraminidase
INF - NA neuraminidase.description: Required for release of virions in Influenza

rule.name: Import of capsid proteins into nucleus
co-factor enabled replication of circular DNA
Import of Large T into nucleus

effects.rule_name: co-factor enabled replication of circular DNA

rule.name: Import of capsid proteins into nucleus
co-factor enabled replication of circular DNA

effects.rule_name: co-factor enabled replication of circular DNA
co-factor enabled replication of circular DNA

MeV - N Nucleoprotein.name: MeV - N Nucleoprotein
MeV - N Nucleoprotein.description: Paramyxovirus nucleocapsid. Packs a negative sense RNA genome with Polymerase and replication co-factor P.

INF - HA hemaglutinin gene.name: INF - HA hemaglutinin gene
INF - HA hemaglutinin gene.description: The Influenzavirus HA gene enables binding to the plasmamembrane and subsequent endocytosis and membrane fusion.

rule.name: HA binds to sialic acid and mediates endocytosis
Transport of surface proteins to membrane

RSV - G protein.name: RSV - G protein
RSV - G protein.description: Attaches to molecules on the plasma membrane

RSV - F Fusion protein.name: RSV - F Fusion protein
RSV - F Fusion protein.description: Normally in a metastable prefusion conformation. Mediates plasmamembran fusion

rule.name: Transport of surface proteins to membrane

RSV - L polymerase.name: RSV - L polymerase
RSV - L polymerase.description: The RSV RNA dep RNA-polymerase. Requires a co-factor in order to work. In nature, this is P protein.

RSV - P protein.name: RSV - P protein
RSV - P protein.description: RSV co-factor for the L Polymerase. Forms the polymerase complex

RSV - N protein.name: RSV - N protein
RSV - N protein.description: The RSV nucleocapsid. Unpacks and packs negative sense RNA, a polymerase and co-factor

rule.name: Translation of viral RNA for ER

effects.rule_name: Picorna-like RdRp synthesis of sub-genomic RNA

RSV - M2 protein.name: RSV - M2 protein
RSV - M2 protein.description: Improves function of the L polymerases

BUNV - Gn Gc glycoproteins.name: BUNV - Gn Gc glycoproteins
BUNV - Gn Gc glycoproteins.description: Mediate binding to the membrane and endocytosis. Gc is a fusion protein which mediates fusion upon acidification.

BUNV - N protein.name: BUNV - N protein
BUNV - N protein.description: Nucleocapsid of Orthobunyavirus. Encapsidates the three negative sense RNA genome segments, each bound to a polymerase

rule.name: Translation of viral RNA for ER

MeV - Truncated M gene.name: MeV - Truncated M gene
MeV - Truncated M gene.description: Hypermutated M gene prevents formation of new virions

HEV - ORF1.name: HEV - ORF1
HEV - ORF1.description: Polyprotein containing protease and RNA dep RNA Polymerase. Has residual RNA synthesis as polyproteins

rule.name: Picorna-like RdRp synthesis of sub-genomic RNA

HEV - ORF3.name: HEV - ORF3
HEV - ORF3.description: Required for efficient export of HEV

rule.name: Import of co factors into nucleus

ENV - 2A Protease.name: ENV - 2A Protease
ENV - 2A Protease.description: Cleaves host translation factor eIF4G shuts off cap-dependent host protein synthesis. Reduces translation but also Interferon signaling

effects.rule_name: Picorna-like RdRp synthesis of sub-genomic RNA
co-factor enabled replication of circular DNA

rule.name: Picorna-like RdRp synthesis of sub-genomic RNA

Picorna-like RdRp synthesis of sub-genomic RNA

Attachment_1.name: Attachment and endocytosis
Attachment_1.description: You bound to the membrane or entered an endosome. Baby steps.

RNA_1.name: Reach 1 RNA
RNA_1.description: You made or unpacked some RNA. The first step to greatness..

RNA_10.name: Reach 10 RNA
RNA_10.description: There is some replication going on here.

RNA_100.name: Reach 100 RNA
RNA_100.description: Peak RNA suggests you got some serious production going.

DNA_1.name: Reach 1 DNA
DNA_1.description: You made or unpacked some DNA. Congratulations.

Prot_500.name: Make 500 protein
Prot_500.description: That is a lot of protein!

Prot_50.name: Make 50 protein
Prot_50.description: You made some proteins. You are clearly making progress.

New_virion.name: Make a new virion
New_virion.description: You packaged a new virion. Probably with stuff that you brought in...
